definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)

sentences.english: Now if there is blind man who wishes buy pair sunglasses, how should express himself?
sentences.chinese: 现如果瞎子想买副太阳眼镜，如何表达？

sentences.english: Did you notice the sunglasses he was wearing?
sentences.chinese: 你也注意到他戴的太阳眼镜了吗？

sentences.english: He was wearing the plainest of clothes, with sunglasses propped on his head.
sentences.chinese: 他穿着很普通，太阳眼镜放在头顶上。

sentences.english: We wore sunglasses because of the glaring sunlight.
sentences.chinese: 由于刺眼的阳光，我们戴著太阳眼镜。

sentences.english: What about the guy in the sunglasses?
sentences.chinese: 如果碰见太阳眼镜的人又该如何？

sentences.english: What does eyeball of common sunglass cross - eye have to harm?
sentences.chinese: 普通太阳眼镜对眼睛有什么伤害吗？

sentences.english: The two girls are selecting sunglasses in the glass store.
sentences.chinese: 两个女孩在眼镜店挑选太阳眼镜。

sentences.english: Eddie has got a sketch-book and a pair of sunglasses.
sentences.chinese: 爱迪有一个素描本和一幅太阳眼镜。

sentences.english: A consumer checks his look as he tries out a pair of sunglasses in Manhattan. Ophthalmologists agree that the ultraviolet protection matters more.
sentences.chinese: 在曼哈顿，一位顾客在试戴一副太阳眼镜。
面罩型太阳眼镜能为你提供额外的防护。

sentences.english: The sunglass of what color is best, how will choose sunglass?
sentences.chinese: 什么颜色的太阳眼镜最好，怎样来选择太阳眼镜？

sentences.english: The sunglass of what color is best, how will choose sunglass?
sentences.chinese: 什么颜色的太阳眼镜最好，怎样来选择太阳眼镜？

definition: to put on/to wear (mouthguard, contact lenses, hearing aid etc)
